Who: LEGACY, Quickstride, Rat Trap
Location: Outside the Black fortress

Le=
gacy moved ever closer as he recieved Tuscon's message . . .

> " This is T=
ucson Prime, I read you Legacy. We have managed to round everyone up, but w=
e're still trying to apprehend Darkhawk. Night Shift is attempting that now=
. Legacy, while I have your attention, I need to confirm some intel with yo=
u, regarding an ancient legend about the mythical Hydra. From what I've rea=
d, a hydra can not be killed by decapitation, which only promotes the growt=
h of multiple heads at one time. Yet, in this legend, it gives the clue on =
how to slay the beast. Direct fire is the only way to slay a hydra. Can thi=
s knowledge be adapted and utilized as a weapon against Hydras? Can Rodimus=
 and I use the powers within us to subdue him as this legend fortells? I wi=
sh to confirm this before I proceede."

Legacy paused for a moment in an ob=
vious attempt to recall the
requested information. "You are referencing a h=
uman mythological
narrative." Legacy stated. "Human datum is not my forte, =
however I
have been programed with much of their lore."

Legacy floated cle=
arly into view near the Black Fortress as he
continued his communication wi=
th Tuscon, "The one fable recounts a
greek hero identified as Hercules who =
was able to slay the
mythological beast by cutting off each cranial appenda=
ge and then
burning the stump before a new set would grow. An interesting a=
ddition
to that is that one appendage - or head was said to be immortal or
=
unkillable, and had to be placed under a rock."

"As to whether this is app=
licable to Hydras?" Legacy paused for a
moment and then continued, "Insuffi=
cient data, however all presumptive
analysis would seem to indicate that it=
 would be largely ineffective.
Niether Galvatron nor Megatron, the two spar=
ks that make up Hydras,
have evinced any specific or unusual weakness towar=
ds matix energies.
Despite outward appearance Hydras is still generally Cyb=
ertronian in
make up, his outward appearance is only an adaptation to his
s=
urroundings. Also he does not appear to have any of the specific
vulnerabli=
ties or benefits of being a mythological hydra, save for the
ones created b=
y his transform circuits and innate weaponry and
abilities."

Legacy hovere=
d over the ground for a moment as he observed the
surrounding area, then wi=
th the grinding of gears he shifted into his
alternate mode, that of a cybe=
rtronian tank, complete with a massive
foward cannon and a dual turrent can=
non as well. "What gives me pause
. . . " Legacy said as he he landed on th=
e ground, the force of his
landing cracking the ground beneath him slightly=
. ". . . is that the
civilization that created that myth on this planet wil=
l not exist for
the greater part of 4 million years. How is it that you hav=
e come
across such information?"

As he sent his question to Tuscon Legacy =
turned his attention to Rat
Trap and Quickstride,

> Outside, Rat Trap and =
Quickstride also get the transmission.
>
> "This is Rat Trap, I read ya Leg=
acy, Quickstride'n I are on standby out here, just in case they need a litt=
le distraction and some backup."

"Perhaps it is time for that diversion, a=
s from all indication the
entirety of Predacon forces are closing in on Tus=
con and Rodimus'
position." Legacy said to Rat Trap and Quickstride as he o=
riented his
cannon on the Black Fortress' main entrance.

"Prepare yourselv=
es!" Legacy said both over the radio to the others as
well as to those near=
by. Meanwhile his fore cannon glowed for a moment
looking like a spear of c=
orruscating energy. Then it errupted and
massive energies went hurtling at =
the Black Fortress, creating a
searing path across the magma before strikin=
g home against the front
door!

OOC: Airly, it's up to you if Legacy is abl=
e to force open the fornt door.
